intro: Pleurachne sieberi, commonly known as the Sieber's grass, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowering heads are small and clustered, producing numerous tiny seeds. Pleurachne sieberi is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
